title: Mastodon

* has a [thick hide](/wiki/Thick-skinned "Thick-skinned").
* is [herbivorous](/wiki/Herbivore "Herbivore").

* is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong").
* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"). |                                                    |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |                                                    |
| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        | [monst.c#line721](/wiki/Monst.c#line721 "Monst.c") |

A **mastodon** is a large, thick-skinned, [herbivore](/wiki/Herbivore "Herbivore") that is not very common in the dungeon.

## Biology

To be precise, mastodons are a group of species. Not a single species. While the mastodon does resemble the modern [elephant](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/elephant "wikipedia:elephant"), the modern elephant is not a direct descendant of the mastodon.

## Strategy

Although having a moderate speed as compared to [horses](/wiki/Horse "Horse"), mastodons can be [tamed](/wiki/Tame "Tame") for the purposes of [riding](/wiki/Riding "Riding"). Since it has a very good attack, it will make a strong melee-fighting pet.

Consider zapping a tame mastodon (as with any [motile](/wiki/Motile "Motile") pet) with a [wand of speed monster](/wiki/Wand_of_speed_monster "Wand of speed monster"), particularly if you are riding it and/or don't have a [magic whistle](/wiki/Magic_whistle "Magic whistle").

Note that in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") they are represented by q, identical to the far less dangerous [rothe](/wiki/Rothe "Rothe").

## Encyclopedia entry

Any large, elephantlike mammal of the genera Mammut, Mastodon,  
etc., from the Oligocene and Pleistocene epochs, having  
conical projections on the molar teeth.

\[ Webster's Encyclopedic Unabridged Dictionary of the English Language ]

*This page is based on a spoiler by [J. Ali Harlow](http://www.juiblex.co.uk/nethack/VernonSpoilers.html).*

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.0. Click here for more information.](/images/d/d6/Nh360-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.0. Click here for more information.")

**This page may need to be updated for the [current version](/wiki/Current_version "Current version") of *NetHack*.**

It may contain text specific to [NetHack 3.6.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.0 "NetHack 3.6.0"). Information on this page may be out of date.

**Editors:** After reviewing this page and making necessary edits, please change the {{nethack-360}} tag to the current version's tag or {{noversion}} as appropriate.

Mastodon

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Wikipedia has an article about:
Mastodon
This page is a stub. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by expanding this page.
q mastodon
Difficulty 22
Attacks Butt 4d8, Butt 4d8
q mastodon
Difficulty 22
Attacks

Butt 4d8, Butt 4d8

Base level 20
Base experience 611
Speed 12
Base AC 5
Base MR 0
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 3800
Nutritional value 800
Size Large
Resistances None
Resistances conveyed None

A mastodon:

  • has no hands.
  • is an animal.
  • has a thick hide.
  • is herbivorous.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • is strong.
  • can be seen through infravision.
Reference monst.c#line721

A mastodon is a large, thick-skinned, herbivore that is not very common in the dungeon.

Biology

To be precise, mastodons are a group of species. Not a single species. While the mastodon does resemble the modern elephant, the modern elephant is not a direct descendant of the mastodon.

Strategy

Although having a moderate speed as compared to horses, mastodons can be tamed for the purposes of riding. Since it has a very good attack, it will make a strong melee-fighting pet.

Consider zapping a tame mastodon (as with any motile pet) with a wand of speed monster, particularly if you are riding it and/or don't have a magic whistle.

Note that in SLASH'EM they are represented by q, identical to the far less dangerous rothe.

Encyclopedia entry

Any large, elephantlike mammal of the genera Mammut, Mastodon,
etc., from the Oligocene and Pleistocene epochs, having
conical projections on the molar teeth.

[ Webster's Encyclopedic Unabridged Dictionary of the English Language ]

This page is based on a spoiler by J. Ali Harlow.


This page may need to be updated for the current version of NetHack.

It may contain text specific to NetHack 3.6.0. Information on this page may be out of date.

A '''mastodon''' is a large, thick-skinned, [[herbivore]] that is not very common in the dungeon.

==Biology==

To be precise, mastodons are a group of species. Not a single species. While the mastodon does resemble the modern [[wikipedia:elephant|elephant]], the modern elephant is not a direct descendant of the mastodon.

==Strategy==

Although having a moderate speed as compared to [[horse|horses]], mastodons can be [[tame]]d for the purposes of [[riding]]. Since it has a very good attack, it will make a strong melee-fighting pet.

Consider zapping a tame mastodon (as with any [[motile]] pet) with a [[wand of speed monster]], particularly if you are riding it and/or don't have a [[magic whistle]].

Note that in [[SLASH'EM]] they are represented by {{brown|q}}, identical to the far less dangerous [[rothe]].

==Encyclopedia entry==

{{encyclopedia|
Any large, elephantlike mammal of the genera Mammut, Mastodon,
etc., from the Oligocene and Pleistocene epochs, having
conical projections on the molar teeth.
|[ Webster's Encyclopedic Unabridged Dictionary of the English Language ]
}}
